Reviews.Title: The most powerful computer that weighs less than 4lbs
Reviews.Author: Hubert Heller
Reviews.Content: Pros: - 15.6" TFT Screen 1920x1080- Powerful: PCMark 7 Score: 4674- 8 GB RAM- lightweight: 3.9 lbs  (Randall Bateman Writer's review is incorrect.)- quiet (much quieter than any other notebook I have owned. Also does not get hot.)- long battery life  (12 hours in idle, 6 hours internet browsing)- comes with Windows 7 (and a free upgrade to Windows 8 for those who want it)- Samsung qualityCons: I wish it came with a 512 GB PCIe SSD, 16GB RAM, and and a matte screen!Other Thoughts: The lightest 15.6" laptop in the World is a true competitor to the 15 - inch MacBook Pro (which weighs 4.4 lbs)Especially if you prefer WIndows 7 - with the 1920x1080 screen there are no scaling problems!

Reviews.Title: trackpad and driver problems
Reviews.Author: Randall Bateman "Writer"
Reviews.Content: First thoughts:HEAVY >4 pounds - 1/2 pound heavier than prior version (especially compared to NP900X3B and NP900X4D both of which we own)LARGER - by about an inch, which makes it look and feel much larger than the NP900X4DGLOSSY - the box says low reflectance - the screen is glossy - turn up the brightness to avoid problemsIMO, this is not the sleek, slender, top-notch versions of prior years. Samsung is holding to their promise of no further development of PCs... I wish I had just ordered another NP900X4D.Battery life initially not so great - at 56% remaining after 3 hours of use this morning. Hoping this is just new system workload...

ProductInfo.Features: Ativ Book 9 / Intel Core I7-4500U / 256Gb Ssd / 8Gb Ddr3 / Intel Hd Graphics 440
ProductInfo.Name: ATIV Book 9 NP930X5J 15.6" LED Notebook - Intel Core i7 i7-4500U 1.80 GHz - Black
